inventory.commentary: Note: this noun is -not- on the official noun list.

sense.name: a short thick sick, often weighted, used as a weapon
sense.examples: The peasants' only weapons were their scythes and hand-crafted bludgeons. The autopsy revealed the scull had been fractured with some type of bludgeon.

sense.name: a technique or manner of attacking
sense.commentary: BLUDGEON[+quality][+manner][+technique][+heavy_handed][+attack] Note: is a figurative, abstract extension of Sense 1
sense.examples: The playwright used the twin bludgeons of ridicule and sarcasm to make his points. Her weekly column contains rhetorical bludgeons to discredit those with whom she disagrees.
